title: Unknown (to me) brush script typeface
content:
Hi everyone

Any ideas for the attached typeface? It looks familiar, but I can’t find it in my books.

Richard Hunt

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Player.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Player.gif) | 1.81 KB |
author: Richard G. Hunt

comments.content: As the script is quite irregular and not so well done (technically speaking) it’s possible this is either a custom job or a freeware/shareware font. As there are a gazillion of those out there it will be quite tricky to nail it. :^/
Thanks. I thought it might be a scanned / modified “real” typeface.
Wow only one repeating character and the angles of the y compared to the P and other characters lead me to suggest custom. Not many designers change angles of their characters.

I think if it were custom, the ‘e’ connectors would be nicer-looking.

- Lex
